turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: What is it we can do for you today?

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Well, we've come to give our boy a little break from the monotony.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: What's wrong, you don't like steak?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I should be eating with the crew.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Humor me.  Eat it anyway.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Why are you here?

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Spying?!

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I can take care of myself.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Oh, really?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Look, you put me on this boat in the first place.  I didn't want to come but I did.  Why do you have to embarrass me.  Why can't you just leave me alone?

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Listen to me, you thankless little prick.  We're your parents, so don't you dare talk to me disrespectfully. What the hell is it, this captain? Because I'll see him in a rowboat...

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: It has nothing to do with him.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Well, what does it have to do with? Us?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: No.  Look, it's me okay?  Can't it just be about me?  For once?

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Who is it Philip?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: It's okay.  I'll be in, in a minute.  Look, what do you want?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I think you were too hard on Weathers.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes.  I do.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I need to know what I'm working with; what their boundaries are. Their lives depend on it, and for that matter so does yours.  We've got to bring them together.  Make them a crew.  We're as strong as our weakest link and I don't want to find that out the hard way.  So, I will challenge them and they will come together.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You know the best thing about being a Skipper is the worst thing.  It's all my responsibility.  So I'll tell you what George, you stay off of my bridge, and I'll stay out of your galley.  We'll get along that way.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What?!  What's happening?!!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You're officer of the watch, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Skip.  It's this damned book.  Lawford gave it to me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Son-of-a-bitch.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: We're short one long boat too.  Come on.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I guess we know what the next acquisition for the galley is going to be...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: A padlock.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Immortality.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Spirits have a way of bringing that out.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: And being sixteen.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: They're in a hurry to grow up.  They don't know about consequences or responsibility.  That's being sixteen too.  I promise you one thing...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: They'll know about it in the morning.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Jesus.  She's got guns.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: She's Cuban.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: They think we're carrying Cuban refugees.  Skipper, they mean to board us.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Not a chance.  Remind them that according to the Geneva Convention, firing on a civilian vessel on the high sea is an act of war.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Oh Jesus, oh Jesus.  Man I knew we shouldn't have gone.  I tried to tell you.  I tried to tell you.  You guys made me come!  You made me come!!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Will you shut up?  You sound like my fucking sister.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Yeah, well you're really gonna have some bad dreams if we find out you didn't.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's enough.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: How the hell are we gonna get outta here?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We'll think of something.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Oh, praise the lord.  Relax everybody.  Everything is under control.  The jug head's going to think of something.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hell, they even kicked me outa vo- tech 'cause I couldn't read a slide rule.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I can show you how to use a slide rule.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why would you do that?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Jesus!  What the hell happened to him.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Lemme go!  Lemme go!!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What's your problem?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Why'd you jump?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Because I felt like it.  What do you care?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I couldn't do it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, as soon as you grow some balls, let me know.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Don't ever call me stupid.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Come on, he didn't mean anything.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'll read it.  I mean I don't mind.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Shut up donut.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: If you've got "a broad" available I'll take her.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Like you'd know what to do with one.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: How would you know?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Trust me donut.  I know.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What?  Come on...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: On the dog watch, night after the storm, I look down into the skylight above Skipper's cabin and there she was, peelin' down.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Damn, Porkchop, you sound just like a guy who ain't never seen a pair.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I've seen 'em.  I've seen 'em.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: They tell you that?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I figured it out.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It matters to me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Okay donut.  Whatever you say.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Why, man?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't have to listen to this.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: You will if you wanna eat.  Right George?

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: That's not a satisfactory answer.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Look, save it for somebody else will ya.  This ancient shit doesn't have anything to do with me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Much have I traveled in realms of gold/ And many goodly states and kingdoms seen/ Round many western islands have I been/ Which bards in fealty to Apollo hold/ Oft of one wide expanse had I been told/ That deep-browed Homer ruled as his demesne.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: You know what he is talking about here?

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: This isn't just a story!!  It's history made allegory.  It is a philosophical handbook for life!  It holds the secret of this very voyage.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What is it... the secret?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: If it were only that simple, my young friend.  Read on, gentlemen. Read on.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: The rust won't wait for you to read Conrad, Goodall.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Then he shouldn't have written such a long poem, Mr. Lawford.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: Read on, young John.  Read on. College boards are coming.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: Well, that was neighborly.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: He didn't get to be Under Secretary of the Air Force by being neighborly.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: What's wrong Mr. Lawford.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: It seems we're short on singers.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: Tie it off!!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Outer.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Barometer's dropping.  The first blow'll come from the south.  Might get interesting.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: We've got a problem.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: Terry left his passport in Curacao. We could hide him...

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: No.  Bring him on deck with the others.

turns.speaker: LAWFORD
turns.text: If he's a Cuban, Castro wears a dress.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Nobody aboard my ship is going anywhere.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You gotta be kidding?  He's a human chum line!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No self respecting shark is gonna take a bite out of you.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: They're waving... handkerchiefs or something.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Fuck off man.  It's just a fish.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No, Phil.  It's a mammal.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You're the one who doesn't care, Phil.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: It hurts too much to care.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: About yourself?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: About anything.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: How long you been standing there?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Long enough.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What are we supposed to talk about?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You've gotta be kidding?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: But, they don't speak English.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: There are some things that everybody does in the same language.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Phil.  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Fandango, Junior.  I'm gonna do some limbo baby!!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: No way Phil.  Not like this.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Roger Meris, steps up, it's a corker down the pipe...

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: It's outta here!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Come on man.  Let's just talk about it.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I don't know.  We gotta get 'im outta here before Skipper sees him like this.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Son of a bitch!!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You're a day late.  We keep a schedule aboard ship.  Lives depend on it.  Hello, Philip.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Sir.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Suicidal...

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: The first thing is I don't like people talking when I'm talking so the two of you, shut up.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Do you have something to say?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Then keep your mouth shut.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Excellent.  Bill, find Mr. Weathers a position to suit his condition.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Do me a favor and tell Bill once she's dogged down I want everyone to break out their slickers and make sure their gear is stowed or we'll spend the next week sorting underwear.  Lawford, Bill, Mike, John, and Phil will stand the watch.  Everyone else hit the racks.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I'm not staying out here.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I have arranged to host a good will cruise for the Dutch students of the local school there.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Joy, rapture...

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Each one of you will be responsible for one student.  I'll expect you to be courteous.  You represent this school and your country.  We'll sail in the morning.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I'm not gonna kill it.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You already have.  Now go on.  Do it.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Swing up, son.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Up you go.  Right now.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: What's it going to be?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Sorry won't cut it.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: What are you blubbering about?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Don't look down.  Look in my eyes! Climb!  We'll do it together.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: You climb damn it, or so help me I'll haul you to the foretop by your diaper and leave you there!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Aaauuuhhh!!!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Are you hating this?!  Are you!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I hate you, you son of a bitch!!!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: No.  Hate the fear inside of you! Climb like a man mister!  Hate it! Hate it away.  Hate your way up one more rung!!  Do it right now!!

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Is it true that you forced Robin Weathers to climb the mast when it was clear that he was acrophobic.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: He climbed when he was ready.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Were you aware that his brother was killed in a fall.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Sir, were you aware at any time of the use of alcohol among the crew.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Yes, I was.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: What makes you so sure it was one?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I can't be sure.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: You really felt that your crew were up for the conditions.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: We'd come twelve thousand miles together, through every kind of seas imaginable...

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Except, a "White Squall".  With all due respect Captain Sheldrake, they're only boys...

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: They are much more than that, sir.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Is it true that the reason you expelled Philip Boutillier...

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: For killing a dolphin.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: ... and that you invited him to strike you?  To fight it out on the deck of your ship?!

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Yes, that's true.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Do you think this is funny?  Some kind of joke?  You lost six people out there.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I don't think one second of this is funny, sir.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANDERS
turns.text: Isn't also true that his vessel went down off of Nantucket?  Lost everyone on board.  In fair weather no less.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: There are allegations questioning your competence with regard to the command of the Albatross.  I have been instructed to convene a formal tribunal to determine whether or not negligence played a part in the sinking.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: May I ask you something?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: How'd you manage to piss off a guy as powerful as Francis Boutillier?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: It wasn't hard.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I used to helm a school ship.  A long time ago.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: The Coast Guard 'Eagle'.  She never lost a race while you were Skipper.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: The families... want your ticket. Turn it in, we forget the whole thing.  Everybody goes home.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: ... Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: The papers are going to eat you alive.  Even if you beat it, you'll never get another commission.  They want someone to be accountable.

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I am accountable.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: And you didn't do anything about it?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: No.  I didn't.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: If this young man had responded instantly to your command, do you believe the ship might have been spared?

turns.speaker: SKIPPER
turns.text: I don't know that anything could have prevented what happened.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Then what are you trying to say then?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Soon as we ship it'll be "forgetta".

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Don't mind him, Chucky.  You're talking to a guy whose idea of big romance is a palm full of Vaseline.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Screw you, Valentino.  I haven't seen you swapping spit with anybody.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Easy for you to say.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?!

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Everybody knows why she went over Tod.  You jibed the boat.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: I was trying to get her up wind! That's what you do when you're hit a-beam.  Or maybe you're too stupid to know that!

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: That's not what Skipper thought.  He was trying to spill air from the main!

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Come in, Montgomery, Alabama.

turns.speaker: CALLER #1
turns.text: Artie? That you, Artie?

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Yes, ma'am. What's on your almost- perfect mind this evening?

turns.speaker: CALLER #1
turns.text: How ya feelin', Artie? I heard you wasn't doin' too well recent.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: I'm fine, thank you. I had a cardiac infarction but I'm on a new diet and exercising regularly. I've never felt better.

turns.speaker: CALLER #1
turns.text: Well, that's so good to hear, Artie. You know some of us depend on you down this way. You're so entertainin' and you get so many interestin' guests.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Thank you. It's listeners such as yourself who made me want to get up out of that hospital bed and back into the studio as fast as I could.

turns.speaker: BEANY
turns.text: I can dig this music... But not that singer.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Why? He's right in the groove.

turns.speaker: BEANY
turns.text: He's so ugly. Guys with beards and beer guts ain't quite my type.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Seein's how you're about as thick as a used string of unwaxed dental floss, don't know how you can criticize.

turns.speaker: BEANY
turns.text: Yeah, well, if he says that all that flab turns into dick at midnight, he's a liar.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Meetin' him at the gate. That phone call this afternoon was the signal. My deranged mama's hid the keys to my car. But of course, I know exactly where they are.

turns.speaker: BEANY
turns.text: I didn't hate me so much, I'd feel better wishin' you luck.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Can't all husbands be perfect, and your Elmo prob'ly wouldn'ta ever got that second one pregnant, you hadn't kicked his ass out.

turns.speaker: BEANY
turns.text: So you're gonna be needin' the "blue- bird" pretty soon?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Real soon... I'll be makin' the swap tomorrow, and thanks again, Beany.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: Sorry, gentlemen. I'm 'most finished on my shoppin' here.

turns.speaker: ERV
turns.text: This be it?

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: Y'all take American Express?

turns.speaker: ERV
turns.text: Yessir.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: Then lemme throw in a couple more things.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: I'd just soon have a paper bag rather than a plastic one, if it's same to you.

turns.speaker: ERV
turns.text: We don't have no paper bags.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: What's Cao Ben?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How old are you?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Twenty.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hey, pretty woman... Sailor here?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: No, he's out changin' the oil in the car.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Man, I gotta take a piss bad... Can I use your head there?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Well... Yeah - okay.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't mean your head head - I'm not gonna piss on your head - your hair an' all... Just piss in the toilet. Y'all take a listen - here a deep sound comin' down from Bobby Peru.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hey... You gotta smell in this room of puke... You been pukin' in here, little girl? Huh?... You sick?... Pregnant?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You used the toilet, now you can go - what I do around here ain't any of your business, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You know, I really do like a woman with tits like yours that talks tough and acts like she can fuck like a bunny... Can you fuck like that?... You like it like a bunny?... Huh?... Cause baby, I'll fuck you like a real good like a big ol' jack-rabbit bunny... Jump all around in that hole... Bobby Peru doesn't come up for air.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Am I scarin' ya?... Your pussy wet?... Come on... is it?...  Hey, don't jump back so slow... I thought you was a bunny... Bunny jump fast - you jump back slow... Mean somethin', don't it?... Means somethin' to me... Means you want Bobby Peru... You want Bobby Peru to fuck you hard baby - open you up like a Christmas present.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bobby Peru grab you now... Hold you tight... Feel everythin' in you now... Stay quiet... Say "fuck me" and then I'll leave.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: No way... GET OUT!!!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Say it!... I'LL TEAR YOUR FUCKIN' HEART OUT, GIRL... Say "fuck me" soft - then I'll leave. Say "fuck me"... Whisper it... Then I'll leave... Say it... Say it - Say it - Say it...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Whisper it... Whisper "fuck me"... Whisper... Whisper... Whisper... Whisper...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Fuck me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Someday honey, I will... But I have to be goin' now... Conta i no joras...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm from all over.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You was in the Marines, huh?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Need a hand?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Thanks, Bobby, 'bout done.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How 'bout a beer?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: That'd be fine, Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Let's go by Rosarita's. You been there yet?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: No, haven't heard of it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Thought maybe Sparky and Buddy'd taken ya. Come on, I'll drive.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: This your car?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hell, no, belongs to my girl's sister. The sister's been over to New Orleans, lets us have it while she's gone. Where's that pretty little lady of yours today?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Restin' in our room. She ain't been feelin' well.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sorry to hear it.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: New Orleans, huh?... We was just there.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Thought you said this was a private club. How come I'm allowed in without bein' a member?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You black?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You an indian?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Then you're a member... Three or four millionaires in here right now.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: They look like a bunch of good ol' boys to me. I guess it's oil money, huh?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oil, gas, cattle, farmin'. Ain't nobody shows off around here. Iguana County's one of the richest in Texas.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Wouldn'ta guessed it, that's sure.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ready for another?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I been studyin' a situation over in Lobo, take two men to handle it.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Feed store keeps up to five K in their safe. Need me a good boy for back-up. Even split. You interested?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: No... I don't think so, man.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Be easy, Sailor. There's two employees. I take one in the back to open the safe, you keep the other'n covered... You ain't plannin' on raisin' a fam'ly in Big Tuna, are ya?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Whattaya mean family?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well... I mean like Lula bein' in a family way.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Lula tell you she's pregnant?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Couple grand or more'd give you two a leg up. Get you to the west coast, Mexico, most anyplace, with a few dollars in your jeans. I got it figured good, Sailor.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: When did you talk to Lula?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Talked to her this afternoon... While you was out.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: She really say she was pregnant?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Just took a guess is all... You in or out on this deal?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I ain't fuckin' sure, Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't think about it too long.  You had enough?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Have now.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Come on outside, I got somethin' to show ya.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How much money you have between the two a'ya right now?...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Forty bucks...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: This is easy money, pardner... No ones gonna get hurt in this thing... And I don't think you can afford not to take it... I'll be bringin' the Eldo 'round the front of the motel at ten tomorrow mornin'... If you ain't a pussy - you'll be there.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I don't particularly care for that kind of talk, Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hey... I never said you was a pussy... Always figured you had the big ol' round balls for this kind'a thing... Sure would set you and that pretty little girl up good.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Yeah... yeah... I guess so... That kind'a money'd get us a long way down that yellow brick road...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: ...But DAMN man... This better go smooth.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Like takin' candy from a fuckin' baby...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What's she doin' here?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: She's my girl... She's drivin'... That bother you?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Why should it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's right... Take one of these.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Panty hose. Work better'n stockin's. Pull one of the legs down over your face and let the other leg trail behind your head. You get the pistol.  Remember, soon as we get inside, you keep that bad boy up where those hicks can see it. Once they notice the Ithaca and the Smith, they'll know we ain't foolin' with 'em.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Nice of you to drop by.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Told ya I would. You still riled?

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: You still screwing sixteen-year-olds in the ass?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ain't never had no girl pull a blade on me.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Wish I'd fuckin' cut you up good.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You heard from Reggie?

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Juana called. They're stayin' another week.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: The cobra's waitin' to strike, chica.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: That guy Sailor came around this afternoon... Asked me if there was a contract out on 'im.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No shit?!?! You know him?

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Used to.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: No, of course.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's right... Could have a bad accident, though... before... durin'... or after a hold-up...

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: What's gonna happen when he sees me drivin' the car tomorrow?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Maybe he'll get a little nervous, but who gives a shit?

turns.speaker: BUCK
turns.text: Gas?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Got enough, thanks. We're lookin' for a place has some music, where we can maybe do some dancin' - get somethin' to eat, too. Anything like that around here?

turns.speaker: BUCK
turns.text: Mostly black though in that boogie place.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What's the name of it?

turns.speaker: BUCK
turns.text: Club Zanzibar.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You say it's straight ahead a mile?

turns.speaker: BUCK
turns.text: About. Where Lafitte crosses over Galvez Highway. State Road 86.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Thanks.
